events.description: US equity futures rebounded on Friday after steep losses in the previous session.
Amazon announced plans to invest $200 billion in AI infrastructure this year.

facts.fact_text: S&P 500 futures rose 0.6%, Nasdaq 100 futures advanced 0.8%, and Dow Jones futures gained nearly 180 points.

evidences.evidence_text: S&P 500 futures rose 0.6%, Nasdaq 100 futures advanced 0.8%, and Dow Jones futures gained nearly 180 points, following declines of more than 1% on Thursday.

facts.fact_text: Amazon shares fell nearly 8% in premarket trading.

evidences.evidence_text: Amazon shares slid nearly 8% in premarket trading after the company announced plans to invest $200 billion in AI infrastructure this year

facts.fact_text: Nvidia rose 3.4%, Broadcom 3.2%, AMD 3.9%, and Micron Technology 4% in premarket trading.

evidences.evidence_text: AI-linked stocks led the recovery in premarket trading, with Nvidia up 3.4%, Broadcom gaining 3.2%, AMD rising 3.9%, and Micron Technology climbing 4%.
as concerns over AI-driven disruption eased

claims.claim_text: Amazon's pace of spending outstripped growth in its cloud revenue.

evidences.evidence_text: a pace of spending that outstripped growth in its cloud revenue

evidence.evidence_text: US equity futures rebounded on Friday... as concerns over AI-driven disruption eased.

Amazon shares slid nearly 8% in premarket trading after the company announced plans to invest $200 billion in AI infrastructure this year, a pace of spending that outstripped growth in its cloud revenue.
Crypto-related stocks also traded higher as digital assets recovered, with Coinbase jumping 6.1%.
